{{infobox character | people=[[Dwarves|Dwarf]] | name=Gróin | image=The Lord of the Rings Online - Gróin.jpg | caption=Gróin in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Lonely Mountain]] | affiliation= | language=[[Khuzdul]] | birth={{TA|2671}} | birthlocation=[[Lonely Mountain]] | rule= | death={{TA|2923}} | deathlocation= | age=252 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Durin]] | parentage=[[Farin]] | siblings=[[Fundin]] | spouse= | children=[[Óin]], [[Glóin]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Gróin''' ([[Third Age]] {{TA|2671|n}} - {{TA|2923|n}}, 252 years old) was a Dwarf of the [[Longbeards]]. ==History== Gróin was an important figure in the royal genealogies of the [[Dwarves]], Gróin was the grandson of [[Borin]], the younger son of King [[Náin II]], and so could claim direct descent from [[Durin|Durin the Deathless]] himself. In his turn, Gróin was the younger brother of [[Fundin]], father to [[Óin]] and [[Glóin]], and uncle to [[Balin]] and [[Dwalin]], all four of whom travelled on the [[Quest of Erebor]].{{App|Durin}} Through his son Glóin, he was also grandfather to [[Gimli|Gimli Elf-friend]] of the [[Fellowship of the Ring|Company of the Ring]]. For all his genealogical importance, though, we know almost nothing of his life. His dates of birth and death, though, show us that he was alive at the time of [[Smaug]]'s [[Sack of Erebor]], and the [[War of the Dwarves and Orcs]] twenty-nine years later. It is likely that he was present at both these events. ==Etymology== [[Jim Allan]] has suggested that ''Gróin'' (like ''[[Grór#Etymology|Grór]]'') is derived from [[Old Norse]] ''gróa'' ("to grow"), thus meaning "Growing-one".[[Jim Allan]], "Giving of Names", in ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', p. 225 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | | NAI | | | | | | | | | | | |NAI=[[Náin II]]
